sentences.english: Yet one day, she decided to leap out the constrictions of her world.
sentences.chinese: 可是有一天，她决定要跳出这个世界的羁绊。

sentences.english: But we do need a little freedom from our leashes on occasion.
sentences.chinese: 当然有时候也需要不受羁绊和一点点的自由。

sentences.english: Don't be too single-minded. It will only serve to bind you later on.
sentences.chinese: 别太钻牛角尖，这只会成为你日后的羁绊。

sentences.english: The less attachment you have, the less anxiety you bring into your life.
sentences.chinese: 你拥有的羁绊越少，你给自己带来的忧虑就越少。

sentences.english: Then you become free of all laws and all gravity.
sentences.chinese: 那么你就自由于法律和所有的羁绊之外。

sentences.english: We only between fetter, called my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间唯一的羁绊，叫刻骨铭记。

sentences.english: Love should not be a fetter , so I chose to let you go.
sentences.chinese: 爱不能成为羁绊，所以要选择放手。

sentences.english: My dear friends, if, without shackled by the real life, what kind of life do you want?
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的朋友，如果没有现实的羁绊，你愿意做什么呢？

sentences.english: Big sky, people have the fetter, will not as wild taraxacum floating.
sentences.chinese: 偌大天空，人有了羁绊，就不会随着蒲公英漫天飘浮。

sentences.english: Trying is an effort forward with ties to the past.
sentences.chinese: “尝试”是戴着过去的羁绊，走向前方的努力。

definition: to worry about/to be concerned about
affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
